channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Again someone dumping their unwanted items, 17th December
item.description:
At 13.15 today there was a lot more waste I think the JMB cleaner may have partially tidied it up.but there is a glass mirrored cabinet near to our recycling bins and where we enter the car park which is unaafe

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Brunswick Court, Old Kent Road, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Abandoned & Untaxed Transit Van Willrose Crescent, 17th December
item.description:
This Ford Transit Van looks to have been abandoned on the street on Willrose Crescent in Abbey Wood (top end of the street). I also note from doing a vehicle check that it has been untaxed for more than a year now. It has also been left with both the back door and the driver's door open and the driver's door window down. So it very much looks like it has been dumped there. Can the council please remove this from Willrose Crescent asap. Thank you.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Willrose Crescent, Abbey Wood
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:

item.title: Rubbish dumped on the road and pavement, 17th December
item.description:
This was dumped yesterday. It is obstructing the road and the pavement It is directly outside my house which is number 13 badgers croft

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Badgers Croft, Eltham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Two clamped vehicles, 17th December
item.description:
There are two vehicles outside Nightingale Court, Valley Road, Shortlands, which have been clamped for some time now (3 weeks at least) and they are occupying 2 parking spaces within the bays which are not for permit holders only and which are in short supply now in Shortlands. Can they not be moved to a compound in the interim?
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Valley Road, Shortlands, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Knights Hill SE27 around about 30 yards south of, 17th December
item.description:
Knights Hill SE27 around about 30 yards south of Ernest Avenue junction on the west side footpath (north bound traffic side) is a pole with a Yellow Line enforcement plate attached to said pole. Said pole has a A3 size or similar polycarbonate boards secured with plastic zip ties so will need a knife and ‘snipes’ to remove. Please forward fixmystreet.com link to your contractor for report map pin and Google Streetview link:
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 128, Knight's Hill, West Norwood, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Knight's Hill, West Norwood, Greater London

item.title: Knights Hill SE27 / Crown Lane junction flyposters, 17th December
item.description:

item.title: Vehicle detector aligned incorrectly or faulty, 17th December
item.description:
Vehicle (infra-red) presence detector does not seem to be detecting traffic waiting behind motor vehicle stop line. It only seems to detect cycles, or eventually when motor vehicles have moved into the cycle box. It means they are often stuck on red, and then vehicles attempt to cross junction on red light, risking safety.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Dunton Road, Old Kent Road, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pothole approx 18 inch long by 2 inch deep, 17th December
item.description:
Pothole Approx 18 inch long by 2 inch deep on Dartford Road, Bexley by number 20. Catching tyres and could endanger pedestrians if cars try to avoid it .
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 9, Dartford Road, Coldblow, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dalston area traffic diversion signs continually fallen, 17th December
item.description:
I've reported this before and it's such a persistent problem that only a staff member regularly checking the route to ensure every sign is positioned rightly in relation to the traffic flow will work. They are too heavy for me and many others to move.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Dalston Lane, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Missing litter bin at top of Navarino, 17th December
item.description:
I reported this earlier this week and was assured it had been fixed, and indeed I saw it when I went out, but it has DISAPPEARED AGAIN today; people will litter at this spot if a bin is not provided; the bin gets full every week.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Dalston Lane, Hackney, London

item.title: Again !!!, 17th December
item.description:
Another fly-tip at the front of this shop that’s been derelict for over 20 years. Lewisham Council has the power to take possession of this premises and to let it, which would benefit the area with a new business at the same time as deterring these regular piles of rubbish on the pavement.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 61a, Dartmouth Road, Forest Hill, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
